{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <HEAD>In der Hoch-Obrigkeitl. Buchtruckerey zu Bern und folgende B3�9cher in gar geringem Prei3�fc zu haben, als:</HEAD>
  <BIBL n="1">
    <AUTHOR>J. H Ringieri</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>CX. Conciones de Ccena Dominic.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>3. Vol.</VOLUME>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Bern.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1680</YEAR>
    <NOTE>das Eremplar in albo achthalben</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>bz.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL n="2">
    <AUTHOR>Rissenii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Summa Theolog.</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>in 8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Bern.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1703</YEAR>
    <NOTE>3�86</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>10. Batzen,</PRIZE>
    <NOTE>und auff Schreib-papier</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>14. Batzen.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL n="3">
    <AUTHOR>Rodolphi</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Compend. Theol. Christ</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Bern</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1713</YEAR>
    <NOTE>3�86</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>8 Batzen.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL n="4">
    <AUTHOR>Altmanns</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Carechetischer Le3�8chter und Rauchwerck, d. i. Erkl3�a7rung und Gebatt 3�bcber den Heydelbergischen Catechismum,</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Bern,</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1711</YEAR>
    <NOTE>mit dem Kupffer-Btatt haltet</NOTE>
    <EXTENT>15. und ein halben Bogen,</EXTENT>
    <NOTE>3�86</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>5. Batzen.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL n="5">
    <TITLE>Biblia Piscatoris</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>in 4to.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Rein,</PLACE>
    <NOTE>3�86</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>15. Batzen.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL n="6">
    <AUTHOR>Seelmatters</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Ewig- vest-bestehender Berg Zion, oder: der vest-gegrundete un3�bcberwindliche Gnaden-Stand der Kinderen GOttes,</TITLE>
    <NOTE>gr3�9cndlich vorgestellt 3�bcber die Worte des 125. Pfalms</NOTE>
    <REF>9. 1.</REF>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <PLACE>Bern.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1704</YEAR>
    <NOTE>3�86</NOTE>
    <PRIZE>5. Batzen.</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":19,"explanation":"Made the XML well-formed and structured: 1) Added a HEAD element for the introductory sentence. 2) Removed stray numeric enumerators and recorded them as n attributes on each BIBL (six additions). 3) Wrapped free-running prose and separators into NOTE elements where appropriate (after YEAR in item 1; separator and the phrase “und auff Schreib-papier” in item 2; separators in items 3, 4, 5, and 6; the descriptive clause after the title in item 6; and the note before EXTENT in item 4). 4) Corrected a mismatched closing tag </PRICE> to </PRIZE>. 5) Re-tagged a non-price quantity in item 4 from PRIZE to EXTENT. 6) Re-tagged the misused FORMAT element containing “9. 1.” to REF. All tags are now properly nested and closed."}

parsed.explanation: Made the XML well-formed and structured: 1) Added a HEAD element for the introductory sentence. 2) Removed stray numeric enumerators and recorded them as n attributes on each BIBL (six additions). 3) Wrapped free-running prose and separators into NOTE elements where appropriate (after YEAR in item 1; separator and the phrase “und auff Schreib-papier” in item 2; separators in items 3, 4, 5, and 6; the descriptive clause after the title in item 6; and the note before EXTENT in item 4). 4) Corrected a mismatched closing tag </PRICE> to </PRIZE>. 5) Re-tagged a non-price quantity in item 4 from PRIZE to EXTENT. 6) Re-tagged the misused FORMAT element containing “9. 1.” to REF. All tags are now properly nested and closed.
